DESC_CRYSTAL_DRIFTER_GIANT: Huge flighted creature formed from coldshard.
NOTE_SHAKRA: She has lived a mere fraction of my lifetime and yet her rings prove a ferocious match. As gifted a warrior as I have ever encountered, and one I am fortunate to call a friend.
NOTE_BONE_THUMPER: Sheer bulk makes for an effective weapon, but requires much sustenance. This creature would have spent most of its time eating. An acceptable life for some.
NOTE_ABYSS_CRAWLER_LARGE: These ones grow large, yet I have never observed them eating, or sleeping. They seem such simple bugs... but I suspect they are not truly our cousins.
DESC_BONE_BEAST: Huge, hardbone bug that lives within and travels through the veins of old bells across Pharloom.
DESC_PILGRIM_03_SONG: Winged devout of the Citadel, carrying a brace of gilded bells.
NOTE_PEAKS_DRIFTER: This one would make a perfect pet, but for the freezing temperatures it requires for comfort.
NOTE_DUSTROACH_POLLYWOG: These creatures look to have been bred deliberately in watery pens. If they are food to be, their scent suggests they must taste vile.
NOTE_BONE_HUNTER_CHIEF: Their skill once saw them chosen, and I can plainly see why. They would have lived and trained only for this duty.
NOTE_PILGRIM_04_SONG: For this bug to have survived Pharloom's climb it must have teamed with stouter companions. I cannot imagine it succeeding alone.
NOTE_PILGRIM_02_SONG: Did this one grow large thanks to the Citadel's excess, or was its formidable size the reason it ever survived to reach this place?
NOTE_SKULL_KING: Though surely fierce, the skull it bears looks taken from an even larger beast. If not for the bones as proof, I would scarcely believe bugs could grow to such scale.
NOTE_CLOCKWORK_DANCER: Two cogwork bugs, and yet the soul seemed singular? A sad, yet masterful imitation of life, imbued inside shells of iron.
DESC_DRAGONFLY_LARGE: Heavy insect that lives near large bodies of water. Its weighty body is best avoided.
DESC_FLOWER_DRIFTER: Drifting bug disguised as a flower. Disperses crackling clouds of pollen if threatened.
DESC_BLACK_THREAD_CORE: Dense knot of husks bound tight by void soaked Silk.
NOTE_BLADE_SPIDER_HANG: A smart hunter learns to wait long in ambush, always ready to strike the first blow.
DESC_BONE_HOPPER: Grazing creature with sharp senses that nimbly retreats from danger.
DESC_FIELDS_FLOCK_FLYERS: Tiny, timid creatures that huddle in flocks and flee at the first hint of danger.
NOTE_DOCK_GUARD_THROWER: Lost in the madness of the Haunting, they still commanded the endless excavation of their caves.
NOTE_GRASSHOPPER_SLASHER: They rarely relax, always alert for potential danger, even deep in their own territory. To defeat them my focus must match their own.
DESC_SONG_AUTOMATON_02: Steam shooting automaton, forged to clean the Cogwork Core and keep it free of infestation.
DESC_SLAB_FLY_SMALL: Sticky young fly, born and grown in service to the Slab.
NOTE_SWAMP_DUCTSUCKER: This mindless bug seems to sense only through its tendrils, yet despite that simplicity it still poses a serious threat.
DESC_PILGRIM_03: Basic bug of Pharloom, laid low upon the ground.
NOTE_BONE_CRAWLER: I am fond of simple, effective traps such as this bug's extendable spikes. An unwary predator would be skewered clean through.
DESC_PILGRIM_04: Short pilgrim that uses their long horn to launch upon threats.
DESC_PILGRIM_05: Thick-set bug consumed by haunted thread. Uses their solid frame to crush others.
DESC_MOSSBONE_CRAWLER: Fur covered crawler with a series of sharp spikes along its back.
DESC_BONE_WORM: Burrowing worm that uses its many blunted teeth to dig through even the hardest bone.
NOTE_SLAB_FLY_BROODMOTHER: With this one vanquished, I hope to have sped the end for that jail and its distasteful order.
DESC_CORAL_SWIMMER_SMALL: Gelatinous coral drifter of simple mind and placid demeanour.
DESC_WISP_PYRE_EFFIGY: Totem and god, built and worshipped by the Burning Bugs.
DESC_FIELDS_GOOMBA: Skittish scrambler of the Far Fields. Its antennae resemble stalks of grass to aid in camouflage.
DESC_SLAB_FLY_SMALL_FRESH: Infant fly, freshly hatched. At this age the soft, blind fly is little more than a bother.
DESC_BONE_HOPPER_GIANT: Tall creature with sharp senses. Defends its herd with powerful legs and a sharp tipped mask.
DESC_SONG_PILGRIM_02: Cruel physician of Whiteward, responsible for operations and modifications on the Citadel's bugs.
NOTE_LAST_JUDGE: The huge Judge likely stood through countless generations, never defeated, never wavering in their charge.
NOTE_FARMER_CATCHER: These bugs look to have spent every waking moment at their work. Grim, endless labour in service of the unseen Citadel above.
NOTE_BONE_HOPPER: Despite the Haunting of its shell, it has not been overcome with aggression. Its desire to flee remains too strong.
DESC_CORAL_GOOMBA_LARGE: Coral hulk with a dense shell, bred to immense size by the Citadel's Memorium.
DESC_PILGRIM_02: Sturdy bug lost to the Haunting. Rolls at threats with no care for its own discomfort.
DESC_GLOOMFLY: Tiny empty creature, barely a bug. Swallows its prey whole and sucks their nutrients until nothing remains.
NOTE_FLOWER_DRIFTER: Quite a beautiful creature. In my own kingdom's court it would have been highly favoured as an ornamental pet.
NOTE_BONE_HOPPER_GIANT: There is surprising strength hidden in their thin, elegant limbs. It would be a pleasure to ride upon it...
NOTE_SPINE_FLOATER: Whatever admiration I had for its fleecy down is spoilt by its disturbing mask... and its steely spines.
DESC_SHIELD_DOCK_WORKER: Cymbal bearing worker of the Deep Docks. Pans the hauls of smokerock to find traces of more precious minerals.
DESC_TAR_SLUG: Sticky mollusc that defends itself by spraying burning fluid from growths on its back.
NOTE_SWAMP_DRIFTER: This one is pretty, but not as soft as first it seems. The plant it mimics is flaked and coarse, and the bug's coat shares similar texture.
DESC_DOCK_WORKER: Low level worker lost to Pharloom's Haunting. Instinct keeps them at their task, though in much simpler fashion than before.
NOTE_BLADE_SPIDER: Something in their assault reminds me of my own skill, though their talents are born purely of instinct. My technique is formed from hard training.
NOTE_RHINO: Certain tools and skills can pierce its defences. I should adjust my strategy as needed.
DESC_FARMER_CATCHER: Bug charged to catch dregs of Silk that fall from the Citadel. Will attack with its staff if provoked.
NOTE_MITEFLY: Similar bugs would gnaw away at unguarded food supplies in my homeland. As a child I would hunt them, eager to make use of myself and test my skills.
DESC_SONG_AUTOMATON_GOOMBA: Automaton built in the shape of a scuttling bug. Its back contains retractable pins, intended to cut song cylinders free of any obstruction.
DESC_PILGRIM_STAFF_UNDERSTORE: Uses their steel bristled pin to scrub the soot from vents and pipes.
DESC_BONE_HUNTER_TRAPPER: Huge, yet stealthy Skarr. An expert trapper and master of the undergrowth.
DESC_ABYSS_TENDRIL: Lashing fragments of pure darkness, shaped into sharpened tentacles.
DESC_BONE_GOOMBA_LARGE: Soft bug beneath a huge, horned skull. Charges at intruders to protect its territory and its smaller companions.
DESC_BONE_CIRCLER: Common winged bug of the lowlands. Generally docile, but will attack if threats come close.
NOTE_SLAB_FLY_SMALL: Foul creatures birthed into servitude. Their plight elicits no sympathy from me.
NOTE_SHIELD_DOCK_WORKER: The Haunting has stolen some important part of these bugs, yet still they attempt their former task. Until, that is, they sense my presence...
DESC_BONE_WORM_BLUEBLOOD: Mutated young worm infected with Plasmium. The new form displays potent regenerative skill.
NOTE_SONG_AUTOMATON_01: Its core is filled with fine mechanisms, but that alone should not produce such a convincing mimic of life. Silk must also be used to animate this artifice, though exactly how I am not sure.
NOTE_STICK_INSECT_CHARGER: Its shell gives it the advantage of surprise, but also forces it into a slender, brittle shape that cannot withstand a heavy attack.
DESC_LILYPAD_TRAP: Predatory plant with a powerful jaw shaped to resemble a lily pad.
DESC_MITEFLY: Airborne pest, less common than its grounded siblings. Attacks with sharp fangs if agitated.
NOTE_CONDUCTOR_BOSS: The souls of so many bugs, obsessed with Silk, consumed by it. Their pain shall forever remain in that pit. Even I do not possess strength enough to cleanse it.
DESC_LOST_LACE: Silk-spun child possessed by the void.
DESC_ABYSS_CRAWLER: Shell-plated worm found only in the deepest depths. Seems to survive despite consuming no food or liquid.
DESC_SWAMP_MUCKMAN_TALL: Trap setting bug carrying a pouch of sharpened long-stakes.
DESC_GNAT_GIANT: Aged female mite, grown larger and stronger than most of its kin.
DESC_ABYSS_MASS: Mass of old masks swollen and animated by writhing void.
DESC_ROSARY_THIEF: Pernicious looter found all over Pharloom.
DESC_SLAB_PRISONER_FLY_NEW: Small bug, shackled and cowled for sin committed within the Citadel.
DESC_HORNET_DRAGONFLY: Flighty insect that lives beside still waters.
NOTE_SONG_AUTOMATON_GOOMBA: Its form is certainly based on bugs found outside the Citadel. In my own craftwork, I too often look to nature for inspiration.
NOTE_PILGRIM_04: Birth equipped this one well. In its assault it becomes its own projectile.
NOTE_DOCK_CHARGER: Their heavier bells armour them well against my strikes, but against that oppressive heat... can they help at all?
NOTE_PILGRIM_02: A rare built bug within these ailing lands. Most pilgrims' shells seem small by comparison. What nourishment did they discover to grow so large?
NOTE_PILGRIM_01: With a softer shell than most, they would have relied on their athleticism to survive.
DESC_SURFACE_SCUTTLER: Common crawler that lives beneath sand.
NOTE_BLACK_THREAD_CORE: Silk and shells corrupted. That void seeks now to claim this land whole. These poor shells are only the beginning.
DESC_CROW: Screeching scavenger that roosts high in caverns and preys on passing pilgrims.
DESC_STICK_INSECT: Insect formed to imitate a branch, capable of remaining perfectly still for long periods, but unexpectedly swift when roused.
NOTE_CRYSTAL_DRIFTER_GIANT: This larger form carries so much weight it can barely move from its place.
DESC_WEAVER_SERVITOR: Small construct built by Weavers past, brought to life through Silk runes threaded within.
NOTE_SLAB_FLY_SMALL_FRESH: The less these gruesome bugs breed, the better.
DESC_SCROLLKEEPER: Gilded servant of the Whispering Vaults, born to read and recall the near endless scrolls of prayer.
NOTE_SONG_AUTOMATON_FLY_SPIKE: I cannot decipher its function to the greater Core. Is it built for defence? If so, its passivity seems far from optimal.
NOTE_MOSSBONE_CRAWLER: If not for the spikes, I would think it an appealing bug.
DESC_SWAMP_MOSQUITO_SKINNY: Hovering pest with a hollowed proboscis able to spit gobs of sizzling bile.
NOTE_SURFACE_SCUTTLER: This surface dweller is free of Silk. Its nature remains its own. The monarch's influence must only have stretched below it.
NOTE_SCROLLKEEPER: Did they ever truly understand those inscrutable scrolls? Or is it all merely pretence, an endless act to maintain their order's station within the Citadel?
NOTE_STICK_INSECT_FLYER: Its assault... like a young bug's toy turned deadly. Could I, in time, fashion a spinning tool to match?
NOTE_PHANTOM: Though grey with age, their frayed form suggested a being strung from Silk, one who welcomed a decisive end in combat over a slow decline.
DESC_SMALL_CRAB: Infant form of the more formidable Craggler.
NOTE_BONE_GOOMBA_LARGE: Either its size has made it fearless or the Haunting has removed its sense of self-preservation.
NOTE_ZAP_CORE_ENEMY: Barely a bug, and possessing only basic thought, yet instinct alone proved enough to turn it deadly.
NOTE_SAND_CENTIPEDE: Bursts forth at movement sensed close, and will consume any object or bug careless enough to fall into its maw.
DESC_GRASS_GOOMBA: Pointed scurrier posing as plant life.
DESC_MITE: Verminous pest, common throughout the dark corners of Greymoor.
NOTE_CORAL_SPIKE_GOOMBA: Its fur is thick and silky. Sadly, lost to its Haunting, I shall never safely be able to touch it.
NOTE_SPINNER_BOSS: Her body seemed a Weaver's, but her mask had been forcibly removed, and her own Silk was bound useless by heavy pins lodged through her spine.
NOTE_GRASSHOPPER_CHILD: Fierce and fast, and defending their lands even from birth. These are children to be proud of.
NOTE_CITADEL_BAT: Like fabric somehow sprung to life. Its pelt is perfectly matched to the rags it infests.
NOTE_BONE_CIRCLER_VICIOUS: Its wings are quite small compared to its bulk. Perhaps it uses the warm air of these fiery lands to help stay airborne. Clever, if so.
DESC_SONG_ADMINISTRATOR: Gold ranked disciple of the Choir and direct servant to the Citadel's Conductors.
NOTE_PILGRIM_STAFFWIELDER: The large bell seems to signify them as once leader of a climbing troupe, though the Haunting has erased that former authority.
NOTE_STICK_INSECT: Avoiding their ambush is a good test of my senses, and my ability to rapidly retaliate.
NOTE_LOST_LACE: To quell the mother's rage, and see this kingdom saved, I will claim her back. This one... the dark shall not take.
DESC_SONG_KNIGHT: Cogwork knight of Pharloom, once protector of its pilgrims, and master of the scissor blade.
MARROW_START_SIGN:
Pilgrim
You are blessed to walk the foundations of Pharloom.
Humble yourself before the shells of those who gave their lives to hold our kingdom's weight.
RED_MEMORY_ROOT2: <hpage>You are wrong, Lady...<hpage>I knew the wish, and the price to achieve it. And now, across these many ages, I have only come to know it better...<hpage>Strength... in mind, in care, in claw. Strength enough that I may live to see a world better than our own, or to craft a world as I desire. <hpage>That was the wish, of my mother, of my mentor, and of you...<page>...Indeed, spider... So much pain you must have passed to speak our hope so simply...<page>For her you become... who knows clear our desire, and has seen full the darkness beneath our house, I would show you the gift...
CORAL_CRUST_TAB_1:
Coral sways,
Clear water flows,
Upon our river free of time.
RED_MEMORY_ROOT3: Witness, the first light. The only means we possess to resist that void with which our family is forever linked.<page>Reach forth, child grown strong. Wrest it from this remembrance. Burn yourself free from our sad fate...
RED_MEMORY_BEAST: ...Ignore them, daughter... their whispers...<page>...Greater, grander... Weaver, guardian, queen... Those are their desires... not your own. Certainly not mine...<page>...Only if you resist them, you might see it, another hope... beyond...<page>...But to recall these words, in time so far... Will you even remember me, child? Could you?...<page>...A mother... before the mask... before I lay forever in duty...
RED_MEMORY_WEAVERS: ...Show us your craft, child...<page>...Show it splendid, as only we can teach...<page>...Prove yourself more Weaver than Wyrm...
CORAL_CRUST_TAB_2:
At water's source,
And coral's heart,
Our lord born last to rule.
MEMORY_FIRSTWEAVER_2: ...She called us daughters... Called us divine... She lied...
RED_MEMORY_ROOT: ...Alas... spider's child...<page>...For our ways you will think us harsh... You will think us uncaring, unrepentant...<page>...And so we must seem, for such is the cost of our wish...
MEMORY_FIRSTWEAVER_1: ...She called us daughters... She called us divine...
HEART_OUTRO_FLOWER: ...We are life... We are growth... What world without us?...
RED_MEMORY_HIVE: ...Good... Better...<page>...Yet still you will need to be faster...<page>...In time, they will come for you... Those who fear your nature, and those seeking to claim it...<page>...To survive our world you must learn to sting... swift and sudden...
HEART_OUTRO_CORAL: ...Our claws to crush... Our claws to rule... Our claws to save them all...
HEART_OUTRO_GREEN_PRINCE: ...To dance... And love... And end... Together...
WILDS_START_TAB:
Pilgrim
May these fields of flame sear away all impurity.
That you be granted ascendance to the verdant lands above.
SILK_HEART_MEMORY_LACE_1: ...Better a child spun mad... than none...
SILK_HEART_MEMORY_LACE_2: ...Better a child spun frail... than none...
SILK_HEART_MEMORY_LACE_3: ...Better a child spun pure... than them...
MEMORY_NEEDOLIN_2: ...For her light... eternal... our song sustains...
MR_MUSH_RIDDLE_TAB:
We speak the wish of the Master Herald,
he who signs an Age's end.
Under chapel fallen to the monarch's might,
Over camp collapsed to the black thread plight,Scorched field on edge, shells black and burned,
Up towers spinning, near the surgeon spurned,Cage of one who raged against the silken lie,
Fell heart of frost, who soars on high,Past cradle's peak, last test of fitness,
That the age may pass, this shroom its witness.
HEART_OUTRO_ANT: ...How we hunted... How we sang... My children, I saw you glorious...
SILK_HEART_MEMORY_LACE_FINAL: ...From our Silk... A child born loyal...
MR_MUSH_TAB_TALK: <hpage>So, the Herald visits this land too...<hpage>If he is here, now, then great change or a savage end is inevitable. He would care to see nothing else...

MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_TALK_04: <hpage>The bugs of your land, I have watched them, climbing towards their absolution without the flicker of a thought to what it means.<page>Aye. But isn't it always such for those snared to serve your higher caste?<page>Our mortal mob did once act some defiance, unawares maybe, but successful in part, goaded towards it by Weavers' will'n all.<hpage>You speak of the Citadel? Its former function has failed, but I can still sense its purpose, some. It is church and cage both.<page>Aye. Devised by your ancestors that monstrosity, and their wicked, clever minds. A system, or a web they'd likely call it, a way to keep their mother sealed in slumber, and themselves free to lavish in their false rule.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_DELIVERY: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work.<page>Ahh. Know you distort the order of things, Old One. It is a rare want of your caste to serve us mortal bugs.<hpage>I am not my kin, Maker. I have seen enough pain born of their dominion. As much as I may, I choose to stand apart.<page>If your blood allows it so... And my thanks still for the lacquer. Pharloom's fresh faces will welcome its sheen.
MASK_MAKER_REPEAT1_ACT3: Until cavern's collapse, the masks must be made!
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_REPEAT_ACT3: Enough talk, Old One. My contract remains. I'll work till caverns' collapse.<hpage>Very well, Maker. If it is within my power to do so, I shall see your lands saved.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_MEET: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it's rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I've felt the stirrings of our monarch, even all the way out here, the tremors of her kin brought close.<page>You're planning a confrontation with her then? The one atop? Our great, frayed god?<hpage>Our meeting seems inevitable, though first I seek the strength to ensure a favourable outcome.<page>Ha! As I'd have guessed! Your ancient kind aren't told to abide one another peaceably.<page>Well, assuming you prevail, I'll ask only that my labour may continue. No matter the state of these lands, you should well know the necessity of my service.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_PREVIOUSLY_MET_ACT3: Back again, Old One? The effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... those are plainly sensed. The fate for these caverns feels grim.<page>I'll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch's desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I'm not surprised! It's always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
MASK_MAKER_REPEAT1: All deserve a face. A chance to be! Until I wither, for the faceless I shall provide.
MASK_MAKER_REPEAT2_ACT3: To exist, to die, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
MASK_MAKER_DELIVERY: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work. <page>Good! Good! To seal. To protect. May Pharloom's fresh faces gleam bright.
MASK_MAKER_POST: Take reward for service made, visitor! Gift for you, to spend or treasure!
MASK_MAKER_MEET: A visitor! Grand you are. But you have already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
MASK_MAKER_REPEAT3: To work! To work! The masks must be carved.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_PEAK: Did you treat with the creature upon the summit?<page>Your legged ancestors once found her company compelling, enough to build their chambers and their calling device at the height of this perilous peak.<hpage>I have paid my respects, and been granted her favour. Her down now fills my cloak, and does much to ward against the frost of these heights.<page>To pass something so precious... That's a mighty gift you've been given. Seems she's thrown her lot in with you.<page>I'd not have guessed her so opposed to our threaded monarch, but then she too must have sensed the wretched state of things, and the harsher change to come.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_MEET_ACT3: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it's rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I've felt, and heard, the effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... The fate for these caverns seems grim.<page>I'll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch's desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I'm not surprised! It's always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker, for myself and for you mortal few. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
MASK_MAKER_MEET_ACT3: Late! Late you are! And already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
MASK_MAKER_POST_UNMASK: Have some small reward for your troubles, Old One. It's no small thing to deliver that sloshing stuff safe, ‘specially all the way up here.
MASK_MAKER_RELATIONSHIP: A fine face, yours. Not of my work. Not of this kingdom's craft. Not now at least.<page>But the deeper form. Distant relationship. Some form of Pharloom and our old, legged, stewards. <page>Now! To work. To work! The masks are needed.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_TALK_03: <hpage>You have the sight, Maker. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask... It reads clear enough, Old One. Watcher, hunter, monarch even, though you may reject that station.<page>A complex visage, perhaps, yet still to my sight it looks unresolved.<hpage>If you see a transitional state, it is one I have accepted. My mask has remained defined through lifetimes uncounted.<page>Aye. Rigid I'm sure, but your kind rarely develop evenly, and the lifetime of bugs are poor measure for one like you.<page>Could be there's more growth awaiting you yet...
MASK_MAKER_REPEAT3_ACT3: Our world cries its end! But the masks must still be carved.
MASK_MAKER_UNMASK_REPEAT: Enough talk, Old One. Mine is a calling that scant allows rest.<hpage>Very well, Maker. I shall take my leave.
MASK_MAKER_REPEAT2: To exist, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
GATE_PILGRIM_REMEET_NO_SHRINES: The Citadel is calling us, sister! We stand so close. We need only the blessing of those bells to see the Grand Gate open.<hpage>I will awaken the bells, pilgrim. With luck, you will not be waiting long.
GATE_PILGRIM_REPEAT_NO_SHRINES: Only the holy bells of the great path shall open the way!<page>We beg you, traveller, see the bells awoken, that we may cross this final threshold.
GATE_PILGRIM_REMEET_GOT_SHRINES: Ahhh... the gate! The bells have awoken! All along the path. Now we need only music, to see them attuned! <hpage>I have recently learnt the art of producing song by strumming Silk, though I confess it is a skill deserving of more practice.<page>Oh! Ohh! Have no doubt, sister! Play sincerely. Any music is sweet enough! Play for us and surely the bells will resound! Play, and we will sing!
GATE_PILGRIM_REMEET_SHRINES: Ahhh... the Grand Gate! The bells have awoken! <page>We beg you, sister. Play or sing and we shall follow. Call out to the bells of the path and see the gate open!
GATE_PILGRIM_REPEAT_SHRINES: We beg you, sister. Delay no further! Play for us. Call out to the bells of the path and see the Grand Gate open!
GATE_PILGRIM_MEET: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too seek entry to the Citadel. Have you heard of a means to open this gateway?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
GATE_PILGRIM_MEET_NO_SHRINES: <hpage>I have passed several such bells, pilgrim. I know how to see them woken. Tell me what you know of their locations and I shall seek those that still remain silent.<page>Sister? This is a mighty service you willingly perform! What a marvellous gift you would grant to your fellows. <page>Eagerly, I shall tell you of the shrines and their locations, as we have heard them spoken...
GATE_PILGRIM_MEET_ALT: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too would benefit from its opening. Have you heard of a means to pass through?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
GATE_PILGRIM_MEET_SHRINES: <hpage>On my journey up, I passed many large bells housed in old shrines. Each I have struck awake, yet still this gate stays closed. What other task must be done to see us pass beyond?<page>The bells are rung? Then this sacred threshold may now be crossed, for the final task is simple! Only music, played fair and true. Music shall attune the bells, and see the gate descend.<page>It must be you to lead us, sister! You, who brought this blessing! Play or sing and we shall follow.
TOLL_BENCH: A machine with a symbol of a bench.
GET_NEEDOLIN_1: Play ancient melodies by stringing Silk along the needle.
SLAB_LOCK_A: A lock with the mark of ‘Indolent'.
SLAB_LOCK_E: A lock with the mark of ‘First Sin'.
SLAB_LOCK_D: A lock with the mark of ‘Apostate'.
GET_SPRINT_2: Chase down prey and leap great distances.
UI_MSG_DESC_EVAHEAL_2: Silk will regenerate while resting at a bench.
GET_SILKBOMB_1: Weave runes of blazing Silk upon enemies.
GET_BELLBEAST_MELODY_2: Summon the Beastlings and return together to their mother.
GET_SILKDASH_1: Pierce through enemies in a blur of blade and Silk.
GET_SPHERE_1: Attack by whipping a storm of Silk around oneself.
GET_CHARGESLASH_1: Charge power in the needle, then release as a deadly attack.
GET_WEAVER_ART: Silk Skills can be equipped in the Crest screen of the Menu.
GET_HARPOON_2: Silk will be expended. Strike enemies to replenish Silk.

Strike enemies repeatedly to become focused, making needle attacks deadlier.
Heighten focus with additional strikes, and further increase lethality.
GET_HARPOON_1: Fling the needle as a harpoon and launch forcefully towards it.
GET_WALLJUMP_1: Cling to sheer surfaces and leap to rapidly scale heights.
GET_SUPERJUMP_1: Fling the needle upwards and launch to tremendous heights.
GET_SUPERJUMP_2: Silk will be expended. Strike enemies to replenish Silk.
SLAB_LOCK_B: A lock with the mark of ‘Heretic'.
UI_MSG_HCOMBO_1_DESC:
Strike enemies repeatedly to build focus.
Once focused, needle attacks will become deadlier.
ABANDONED_TOWN_DOWN:
A small tunnel leading downward.
Descend to Pharloom?
GET_DESC_WHITE_FLOWER_2: Its pale light wards against the void.
GET_DESC_WHITE_FLOWER_1: Fragile flower taken from a deep and distant memory.
GET_DOUBLEJUMP_1: Fabled feather down, layered within the cloak. Leap again while airborne.
MEMORY_MSG_DESC_SILKHEART_1: Regained the power to regenerate Silk within one's shell.
GET_PARRY_1: Bind Silk around the needle to deflect enemy attacks and instantly strike back.
SLAB_LOCK_C: A lock with the mark of ‘Apostate'.
GET_BROLLY_1: Flare the cloak to ride strong winds or glide gracefully.
GET_BELLBEAST_MELODY_1: Mimic the song of the Bell Beast.
UI_MSG_DESC_FARSIGHT_2: Completion quantities will be displayed in Menus.
ABANDONED_TOWN_UP:
A small tunnel leading upward.
Ascend to the surface?
UI_MSG_DESC_EVAHEAL_1: Eva's soul and strength reside within.
GET_MAP_2: View a detailed map of the world in the Map pane of the Menu.
WEAVER_ART_EQUIP: Equip Silk Skills in the Crest screen of the Menu.
GET_SILK_BOSS_NEEDLE: Spin lethal talons from thread that seek out enemies.
TASKLIST_INTRO_1: Ascend through the lands of Pharloom to reach the Citadel at the kingdom's peak.
GET_NEEDOLIN_2: Silk will be expended. Strike enemies to replenish Silk.
TASKLIST_INTRO_2: View Objectives in the Tasks screen of the Menu.
UI_MSG_DESC_FARSIGHT_1: The state of the world can be sensed.
GET_NEEDLE_THROW_1: Attack by throwing the needle forward. Silk will be expended.
GET_DOUBLEJUMP_2: Soar above foes. Reach new heights. Strike from above.
GET_SPRINT_1: Sprint at blinding speed, beyond one's natural limits.
GET_MEMORY_MELODY_1: Draw out memories of Pharloom's forgotten past.
GET_MAP_1: to view a map of the current area.
Q_SOUL_SNARE_PRE_DESC_WALL: Oi! I'm wishin' for that bothersome bellringer! That you readin' this? Then head up top beside the shrine. Might be we two should have a little chat...
SQ_MELODY_ARCHITECT_PROMPT: One part of the Threefold Melody, entrusted to the industrious Architects.
SQ_BLACKTHREAD_5_FLOWER_DESC_END: The Pollen Heart has been claimed from Nyleth.
QUEST_TROBBIO_2_DESC_INV: Return to the Citadel's Stage, beside the Whispering Vaults.
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_END: That the age may pass, this shroom its witness.
QUEST_ROCK_ROLLERS_DESC_WALL: Flintbeetles have awoken in the Marrow. The gems that grow in their bellies provide a pure, constant warmth. Harvest these treasures and be rewarded!
MQ_CITADEL_ASCENT_DESC_SILK: Confront the one who haunts the lands of Pharloom.
MQ_DIVINGBELL_2_DESC: Find aid in Deep Docks to access its diving bell and descend beneath Pharloom.
QUEST_PINSTRESS_BATTLE_PRE_DESC_WALL: If the world is truly ending, I would test my pin in combat one last time. Come to my home at border's edge and accept my challenge!
QUEST_STEELSENTINEL_DESC: Investigate the resting sites marked by Steel Seer Zi to uncover the location of her vassal.
QUEST_CROW_PRE_DESC: Speak to Creige of the Halfway Home in Greymoor.
QUEST_BEASTFLY_DESC_READY: Turn in the Horn Fragment to Bellhart's wishwall and collect the reward.
MQ_CITADEL_SEEKER_DESC: Ascend through the lands of Pharloom and reach the Citadel at the kingdom's peak.
QUEST_BROLLY_GET_DESC: Hunt Hokers in the Far Fields and collect Spine Cores.
QUEST_STEELSENTINEL_DESC_2: Return to Steel Seer Zi and inform her of Sula's escape.
QUEST_ROACH_KILL_LOC: Crull and Benjin of Sinner's Road
QUEST_CROW_PRE_DESC_WALL: Those blasted crawbugs are fouling up my roof! I've come up with a clever solution to keep them away, but I'll need some help. Enquire at the Halfway Home if you're fit for the task.
QUEST_SAVE_COURIER_SHORT_DESC:
Search for traces of the courier, Tipp, and track his location.

Tipp was last seen in lower Shellwood.
QUEST_PILGRIM_RAGS_DESC_WALL: Those mad, violent pilgrims who haunt the great path... we could make use of their shawls here in Bone Bottom. And felling them would surely be a mercy!
MQ_DIVINGBELL_1_DESC: In Deep Docks, find a way to descend beneath Pharloom.
MQ_BLACKTHREAD_5_DESC: Enliven and acquire the old hearts of Pharloom.
SQ_MELODY_CONDUCTOR_PROMPT: One part of the Threefold Melody, entrusted to the Conductors.
QUEST_BROODMOTHER_DESC_READY: Turn in the Broodmother's Eye to Songclave's wishwall and collect the reward.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_SLAVE_DESC: Fragile egg containing a young Silkeater Queen. Though the Queen cannot gather Silk itself, with time and care it could be raised to breed more Silkeaters.
QUEST_SHAKRA_FINAL_DESC_WALL: Child Wielding Needle, I have caught fresh scent of my master in those stricken swamps beside the Citadel. I ask you now to follow, to meet together at trail's end.
QUEST_FLEAS_DESC_READY: Return to Fleamaster Mooshka of the Flea Caravan, in the Marrow.
QUEST_FLEAGAMES_PRE_DESC_WALL: As was warned long ago, the black times have come. There is one last act to perform. Meet us at what was once called Fleatopia.
QUEST_SAVE_CITYMERCHANT_BRIDGE_DESC:
Search for traces of the merchant, Jubilana, and track her location.

Jubilana was last seen near the Citadel's Memorium.
QUEST_SAVE_CITYMERCHANT_BRIDGE_DESC_WALL: Our dear merchant left to scavenge treasures from the Citadel's Memorium. She's been gone far too long. Please make sure she's safe!
GARMOND_BLACK_THREADED_DESC: Seek out the distressed bug near the Blasted Steps Bellway.
QUEST_BROLLY_GET_DESC_READY: Give the Spine Cores to the Seamstress waiting in Far Fields.
QUEST_EXTRACTOR_B_DESC_INV:
Collect Plasmium from Plasmium buds in the lower Wormways.

Plasmium can be extracted from buds using a fully charged stab from the Needle Phial tool.
MQ_CITADEL_ASCENT_DESC_MELODY_COMPLETABL: Play the Threefold Melody before the statues at the Citadel's heart.
QUEST_SONGCLAVE_DONATE_2_DESC_INV: Donate rosaries to aid the Songclave's residents.
QUEST_PINSTRESS_BATTLE_PRE_DESC: Travel to Pinstress's home at the far edge of Blasted Steps and accept her challenge.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_MEAT_TARGET_MASK: Deliver to Mask Maker on Mount Fay.
QUEST_FIXER2_DESC_INV: Donate shell shards to aid the construction of an icon of hope.
QUEST_ANT_TRAPPER_DESC_READY: Turn in the Grass Doll to Bellhart's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_MOSSBERRY1_PRE_DESC_WALL: Sweetness! Sourness! Bitterness! I need it all with hastiness! If you have the precious fruits, come to me in Mosshome and share all you have!
QUEST_JOURNAL_DESC_READY: Present the filled out Hunter's Journal to Nuu at the Halfway Home in Greymoor.
QUEST_FLEAGAMES_PRE_DESC: Speak to Fleamaster Mooshka of Fleatopia.
SQ_MELODY_CONDUCTOR_DESC: Search the gilded heights of the Citadel for the melody of the Conductors.
QUEST_EXTRACTOR_B2_DESC_READY: Give the Plasmified Blood to the Alchemist at the top of the Wormways.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_ITEM_TARGET_FIXER: Deliver to the Survivors' Camp in the Marrow.
MQ_CITADEL_ASCENT_DESC_MELODY: Learn the Threefold Melody and open the path to the Citadel's crest.
MQ_BLACKTHREAD_1_DESC: Confront the Caretaker and his family in the Ruined Chapel beside Bone Bottom.
SQ_MELODY_ARCHITECT_DESC_GOT: The Architect's Melody has been learned.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_MEAT_TARGET_GOURMAND: Deliver to Mergwin in Choral Chambers.
QUEST_CROW_INV_DESC: Hunt Crawbugs in Greymoor and collect their Ragpelt.
SQ_MELODY_CONDUCTOR_DESC_GOT: The Conductor's Melody has been learned.
QUEST_FINEPINS_DESC_WALL: Our settlement sits defenceless! No more! When the worst comes we must stand ready. Bring us pins of the choirbugs, those blades still sharp and strong.
QUEST_ROCK_ROLLERS_DESC_INV:
Track down Flintbeetles in the Marrow and defeat them to collect Flintgems.

Flintbeetles can be tracked by their stone-sheddings and their aromatic dung.
QUEST_SAVE_CITYMERCHANT_DESC:
Search for traces of the merchant, Jubilana, and track her location.

Jubilana was last seen in the lower Choral Chambers.
QUEST_BELL_HOUSE_CONT_DESC_INV: Donate rosaries to complete the rebuilding of Bellhart.
QUEST_DOCTOR_CURSE_CURE_DESC: Acquire Steel Spines from Crull and Benjin in Sinner's Road so Yarnaby can remove the parasite.
QUEST_COURIER_SONGCLAVE_DESC: Deliver supplies to the Caretaker in Songclave.
QUEST_CROW_INV_DESC_READY: Give the Ragpelt to Creige of the Halfway Home in Greymoor.
QUEST_PINSMITHTOOLS_DESC_READY: Give Pale Oil to Plinney of Bellhart.
QUEST_BROODMOTHER_DESC_WALL: Horrible cries have been heard from that prison beside the Citadel. What profanities must be happening within to cause such awful sound?
MQ_DIVINGBELL_3_DESC: Use the diving bell in Deep Docks to descend beneath Pharloom.
QUEST_SONGCLAVE_DONATE_2_DESC_WALL: How do all of these wretched, lost bugs keep finding their way here?! Each hungry and squalling for shelter! We need more rosaries, so empty your pockets.
QUEST_BROODMOTHER_DESC:
Track down the wailing creature in the Slab and slay it.

The creature can be tracked by its slime trail.
ITEM_EXTRACTOR_PINS_DESC: Hard forged spines, intended for use in heavy machinery and able to pierce through even the toughest shell.
MQ_BLACKTHREAD_4_DESC: Return to the Snail Shamans in the Ruined Chapel beside Bone Bottom.
QUEST_FINEPINS_DESC_INV: Hunt pin-wielding choirbugs of the Citadel and collect Fine Pins.
QUEST_COURIER_FLEATOPIA_DESC: Deliver supplies to the Fleamaster Mooshka in Fleatopia.
QUEST_DOCTOR_CURSE_CURE_DESC_READY: Deliver the Steel Spines to Yarnaby in Greymoor so they can remove the parasite.
QUEST_SHININGCOGS_DESC_READY: Turn in the Shining Cogs to Songclave's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_FIXER3_DESC_WALL: I've heard tell pilgrims sometimes fall down that big hole beside the settlement. Nasty way to end your journey, before it even begins. I could build a bridge, if I only had the materials!
SQ_MELODY_LIBRARIAN_PROMPT: One part of the Threefold Melody, entrusted to the secretive Vaultkeepers.
QUEST_SONGPILGRIM_CLOAKS_DESC_WALL: Our haunted brethren wandering the great halls still wear their fine white cloaks. This settlement would greatly benefit from their protection. Please fetch some for us!
QUEST_ROCK_ROLLERS_DESC_READY: Turn in the Flintgems to Bone Bottom's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_ROACH_KILL_DESC_READY: Deliver the Roach Guts to Crull and Benjin of Sinner's Road.
QUEST_SHELL_FLOWER_DESC_READY: Give the Pollip Hearts to Greyroot of Shellwood.
QUEST_SHELL_FLOWER_DESC_INV: Collect Pollip Hearts from the purple flowers of Shellwood.
QUEST_EXTRACTOR_B_DESC_READY: Give the collected Plasmium to the Alchemist at the top of the Wormways.
QUEST_SAVE_CITYMERCHANT_DESC_WALL: The old merchant pilgrim, Jubilana, was seen wandering down in the Choral Chambers, but she never made it up here. Has some foul fortune befallen her?
QUEST_ANT_TRAPPER_DESC_WALL: A huge red-shell stole my precious keepsake and disappeared into the fields! Please chase down the thief and recover my treasure!
QUEST_PINSTRESS_BATTLE_DESC: Find Pinstress on the stormward side of Mount Fay and defeat her in battle.
QUEST_BELL_HOUSE_START_DESC: Harken, ye holy! Our home has been cleansed of evil, but now we are tasked with restoring its former glory! Share your rosaries with us, that the work may begin.
QUEST_GOURMAND_DESC_READY: Deliver the rare delicacies to Mergwin in the dining chamber of the Citadel.
SQ_MELODY_ARCHITECT_DESC: Search the mechanised core of the Citadel for the melody of the Architects.
MQ_CITADEL_INVESTIGATE_DESC: Venture inside the Citadel and confront the veiled bugs.
QUEST_SONG_KNIGHT_DESC_WALL: Attend this Sentinel's request, Hunter in Red. Meet in halls high, the chamber of its fellows. The way shall be marked.
QUEST_FLEAS_PRE_DESC_WALL: I am Mooshka, humble stranger to this land and master of the Flea Caravan! I wish for aid, that all fleas may travel safely together!
QUEST_FLEAS_PRE_DESC: Speak to Fleamaster Mooshka of the Flea Caravan, in the Marrow.
QUEST_SAVE_SHERMA_DESC_WALL: For the sake of our ailing brothers and sisters, I will descend into the holy Whiteward and search for healing supplies. If you are able, please join me! Company will make the work much merrier.
QUEST_COURIER_PILGRIMSREST_DESC: Deliver supplies to Mort in Pilgrim's Rest.
Q_SOUL_SNARE_DESC: Acquire the necessary components to build a powerful trap.
QUEST_HUNTRESS_DESC: Use tools to acquire organs of various types so Huntress may feed her brood.
QUEST_PINSMITHTOOLS_DESC_INV: Retrieve Pale Oil from the Citadel.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_ITEM_DESC: Heavy cloth sack containing tools, trinkets and medical aids.
QUEST_SHINY_BELL_GOOMBAS_DESC_READY: Turn in the Silver Bells to Bellhart's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_4: Up towers spinning, near the surgeon spurned,
QUEST_HUNTRESS_DESC_READY: Return to Huntress with the organs.
QUEST_COURIER_MASKMAKER_DESC: Deliver Liquid Lacquer to the Mask Maker upon Mount Fay.
QUEST_COURIER_BONEBOTTOM_DESC: Deliver supplies to the fixer Flick in Bone Bottom.
QUEST_BELL_HOUSE_START_DESC_INV: Donate rosaries to aid the rebuilding of Bellhart.
SQ_MELODY_LIBRARIAN_RETURN_DESC: Find a means to play the Sacred Cylinder within the Whispering Vaults.
QUEST_BELL_HOUSE_CONT_DESC: The work of restoring our sacred home is almost complete! May those blessed with rosaries share them with us for this holy purpose!
QUEST_BEASTFLY_DESC_WALL: O Beastfly, raging through the scorching wildlands below! May you hinder good pilgrims no longer! May you be struck down by a holy fury!
QUEST_EXTRACTOR_B2_DESC_INV:
Collect Plasmified Blood from infected creatures in the Wormways.

Plasmified Blood can be extracted with a fully charged stab from the Needle Phial tool.
QUEST_FINEPINS_DESC_READY: Turn in the Fine Pins to Songclave's wishwall and collect the reward.
SQ_BLACKTHREAD_5_ANT_DESC_END: The Hunter's Heart has been claimed from Skarrsinger Karmelita.
QUEST_SONGCLAVE_DONATE_1_DESC_WALL: If this place must provide shelter for every ragged bug who wanders in, we'll need supplies and currency. So if you're reading this, empty your pockets!
QUEST_FIXER3_DESC_INV: Donate shell shards to aid the building of a bridge.
SQ_MELODY_LIBRARIAN_DESC: Search the cloistered wing of the Citadel for the melody of the Vaultkeepers.
QUEST_SKULL_KING_DESC: Hunt a Skull Tyrant of the Marrow.
QUEST_SAVE_COURIER_TALL_DESC:
Search for traces of the courier, Pill, and track his location.

Pill was last seen in lower Greymoor.
QUEST_PILGRIM_RAGS_DESC_READY: Turn in the Pilgrim Shawls to Bone Bottom's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_JOURNAL_DESC: Defeat the many creatures of Pharloom and fill out the Hunter's Journal.
QUEST_FIXER2_DESC_WALL: The road is hard for we pilgrims. I want to build a beautiful symbol of hope, to stand beside Bone Bottom and welcome all those who are about to begin their long journey.
QUEST_FIXER1_DESC_INV: Donate shell shards to aid repairs around Bone Bottom.
QUEST_SONGCLAVE_DONATE_1_DESC_INV: Donate rosaries to aid the growing Songclave.
MQ_BLACKTHREAD_6_DESC: Dive into the void and cut Pharloom free.
QUEST_PILGRIM_RAGS_DESC_INV: Hunt haunted pilgrims of Pharloom and collect Pilgrim Shawls from their bodies.
QUEST_TROBBIO_2_DESC_WALL: In the darkest of shadows, all is made clear. Pharloom draws its final breath, and we few remaining must bear its dying pain. Come to the Citadel's Stage and let us suffer together.
QUEST_ROACH_KILL_DESC: Hunt the Muckroaches of Sinner's Road and collect Roach Guts from their bodies.
QUEST_FLEAS_DESC: Seek fleas across the lands of Pharloom and guide them to the Flea Caravan.
QUEST_MOSSBERRY1_PRE_DESC: Speak to the Druid in Mosshome.
MQ_SILK_SNARE_DESC: Scale the Citadel and ensnare its monarch in a deadly trap.
QUEST_COURIER_FIXER_DESC: Deliver supplies to Flick at the Survivors' Camp.
QUEST_SPRINT_PRE_DESC: Meet with Sprintmaster Swift at the furthest border of the Far Fields.
QUEST_SKULL_KING_DESC_READY: Turn in the Crown Fragment to Bone Bottom's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_MOSSBERRY1_DESC: Collect Mossberries from the moss-covered areas of Pharloom's lowlands.
SQ_MELODY_LIBRARIAN_RETURN_DESC_GOT: The Vaultkeeper's Melody has been learned.
QUEST_SAVE_COURIER_TALL_DESC_WALL: Need help-help quick! Me brother Pill is gone missing, vanished somewhere in Greymoor! Please, to help me find-find him!
QUEST_SPRINT_KILL_DESC: Race Sprintmaster Swift to discover Pharloom's fastest bug.
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_5: Cage of one who raged against the silken lie,
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_7: Past cradle's peak, last test of fitness,
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_6: Fell heart of frost, who soars on high,
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_3: Scorched field on edge, shells black and burned,
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_2: Over camp collapsed to the black thread plight,
QUEST_SAVE_SHERMA_DESC:
Search for traces of the pilgrim, Sherma, and track his location.

Sherma was travelling to the Citadel's Whiteward.
QUEST_FLEAGAMES_DESC_READY: Speak to Fleamaster Mooshka and commence the final ceremony.
MQ_BELLSHRINES_DESC: Awaken the old bells throughout the lands.
QUEST_RUNTRESS_DESC_READY: Return to Runt with the organs.
QUEST_SHINY_BELL_GOOMBAS_DESC_WALL: When searching the bellveins carefully, you can sometimes find rare, silver bells. If we can salvage some, the material would be of great use!
QUEST_THREADCORES_DESC_READY: Return to Bellhart's wishwall to collect the reward.
MQ_CITADEL_ASCENT_DESC_LIFT: Rise above the Citadel and confront the one who haunts the lands of Pharloom.
QUEST_BEASTFLY_DESC:
Track down the Savage Beastfly in the Far Fields and defeat it.

The Beastfly can be tracked by its shell sheddings and claw marks.
QUEST_SHAKRA_FINAL_DESC_INV:
Search for Shakra and her master in Bilewater.

Shakra can be tracked by her trail of rings.
QUEST_SPRINT_PRE_DESC_WALL: Be you nimble? Be you quick? If you would prove yourself Pharloom's fastest bug, meet me at the furthest border of the Far Fields! With all haste!
QUEST_MOSSBERRY1_DESC_READY: Give the Mossberries to the Druid of Mosshome.
GARMOND_BLACK_THREADED_WALL: A distressed bug was heard calling for help near the Bellway atop the great sandy steps. Will no one come to the sad wretch's aid?
MQ_BLACKTHREAD_2_DESC: Reach the source of the black threads within the Abyss.
MQ_BLACKTHREAD_5_DESC_END: Bring the old hearts to the Snail Shamans in the Ruined Chapel beside Bone Bottom.
QUEST_FLEAGAMES_DESC: Achieve the high score in all Flea Games and become the Grand Champion.
MQ_THREADSPUN_TOWN_DESC_INV: Break the silken curse ensnaring the town of Bellhart.
MQ_RESCUE_BELLBEAST_DESC: Descend into the bellway and defeat the hostile creature within.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_MEAT_DESC: Fatty meat of indeterminate origin. Once prepared it will quickly spoil if not stored properly.
QUEST_MRMUSHROOM_DESC_1: Under chapel fallen to the monarch's might,
QUEST_COURIER_SLAVE_DESC: Deliver the Queen's Egg to Styx of Sinner's Road.
QUEST_SHININGCOGS_DESC_INV: Hunt Cogworks in Cogwork Core and collect Shining Cogs.
QUEST_SONGPILGRIM_CLOAKS_DESC_INV: Hunt cloaked choirbugs of the Citadel and collect Choir Cloaks from their bodies.
MQ_BELLSHRINES_DESC_READY: Return to the Grand Gate and open the way to the Citadel.
QUEST_STEELSENTINEL_DESC_READY: Investigate the ritual site beside Bonegrave.
SQ_BLACKTHREAD_5_CORAL_DESC_END: The Encrusted Heart has been claimed from Crust King Khann.
QUEST_SKULL_KING_DESC_WALL: A Skull Tyrant, largest of the Marrow's loathsome boney predators, prowls the caves above the great path. Slay the beast and keep us all safe!
QUEST_ANT_TRAPPER_DESC: Track the one who stole Gilly's keepsake near the Bellshrine between Deep Docks and Far Fields.
MQ_CITADEL_ASCENT_DESC: Scale the Citadel and confront the one who haunts the lands of Pharloom.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_MASK_DESC: Pale glaze used in the preparation and protection of bone masks.
Q_SOUL_SNARE_DESC_GOT: Give the collected components to the Caretaker of Songclave.
QUEST_FIXER1_DESC_WALL: A lotta repairs to be done around here, but I need more materials! All I wish for is some shell shards so I can get to work. Not asking too much, am I?
QUEST_SAVE_COURIER_SHORT_DESC_WALL: My dear little courier was last seen in Shellwood. Please, someone find Tipp and send him home, along with all of his precious stock!
QUEST_THREADCORES_DESC_WALL: Such horror upon the roads! Those black mounds formed of husks and bugs, corrupting everything around. If only someone would cut them down and grant the poor souls their rest!
QUEST_SONGPILGRIM_CLOAKS_DESC_READY: Turn in the Choir Cloaks to Songclave's wishwall and collect the reward.
QUEST_SONG_KNIGHT_DESC: Track the Second Sentinel by their markers left near Songclave.
QUEST_SHINY_BELL_GOOMBAS_DESC_INV: Collect Silver Bells in the bellvein tunnels above and below Bellhart.
COURIER_SUPPLIES_MEAT_TARGET_SLAVE: Deliver to Styx of Sinner's Road.
QUEST_RUNTRESS_DESC: Use tools to acquire organs of various types so Runt may feed.
WOOD_WITCH_CURSE_ACCEPTED: <hpage>Very well. This final rite... what would you have me do?<page>The time... of birth is close. Now give... its shell. Host... the final rite.<page>The time of birth... is near.
SETH_GUARDIAN_TALK_REPEAT: You may rest here in this sacred place, but know, if you choose to step further, you shall see my weapon raised.
WOOD_WITCH_CURSE_OFFER: The time... the time of birth approaches. The bud cries. Yearning. The final rite may begin.<page>White shell. Red cloak. Bug strong and old. The time of birth is near. Aid now the final rite.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_COMPLETE_1: P... Pollip Hearts. Gathered. Gathered all. All that is needed, is given.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_DECLINE: <hpage>I hear your request, but I must decline. My travels will take me far beyond this wood.<page>Decline. No. Decline, not. The time of birth approaches. The first rite must begin.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_ACCEPT: <hpage>If you have knowledge or power to grant, I will aid you. These Pollip Hearts you desire... they can be found about the wood?<page>P... Pollip Hearts. Found in the wood. Yes, bug.<page>Seek out the purple blooms. Inside... the hearts.<page>The time of birth approaches. Pollip Hearts are needed. Bring them, bug, and power will be shared.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_COMPLETE_3: Bug. Cloaked by red. The time of rebirth approaches.<page>First rite is completed. Prepared. For the time of birth.<page>Take... take. The refuse of the rite.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_KEEPITEMS: Rrrr... rite. The first rite must begin. Pollip Hearts are needed.
WOOD_WITCH_CURSE_DECLINED: <hpage>I am unable to help you. Not now. Perhaps another traveller will offer aid.<page>None... none come now. Once times, many bugs. Many. Now none. The final rite... the time of birth approaches...
WOOD_WITCH_MANDRAKE_ASK: Bug. Red cloak. Far-travelled. Bring it here... the bud.<page>It calls. It cries for the rite. Offer it.
SETH_GUARDIAN_DECLINE: Then go no further, that peace may remain between us.
WOOD_WITCH_MANDRAKE_ACCEPT: The bud... weak. New. It must be nourished.<page>Nnn... nourished. It will be nourished.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_ACCEPTED: Seek out the purple blooms. Inside... the precious hearts.<page>The time of birth approaches. Pollip Hearts are needed. Bring them, bug, and power will be shared.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_REOFFER: Bug. Only you are left. None more tread here. None.<page>For the rite. The Pollip Hearts. They are needed. Bring them here, for the rite.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_COMPLETE_2: The first rite. Rite of the pollip. The first rite can begin.
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_CANCOMPLETE: The precious hearts... Give them. For the time of birth, for the rite, they must bleed...
WOOD_WITCH_FLOWER_QUEST_OFFER: The.... the time of birth approaches. Now, the rite of the pollip.<page>Bug. Only you are left. None more tread here. None.<page>For the rite. The Pollip Hearts. They are needed. Bring them here, for the rite.
WOOD_WITCH_MEET: Shhhh... shell. White mask, red cloak.<page>Bug. A living bug.<hpage>A bug I am, at least in part, but you are something quite different. I apologise if I have roused you from some deep slumber.<page>Slumber. Long sleep. But now is the waking.<page>Growth. Time of birth. The time of birth approaches.<page>Heed, bug. The time of birth approaches.
WOOD_WITCH_MANDRAKE_DECLINE: Th... the bud. It must be offered. It calls for it... for the rite.
WOOD_WITCH_REPEAT: The time will come... Soon. The time of birth approaches.
SETH_GUARDIAN_MEET: Halt, stranger. I am charged forever to guard the sacred shrine beyond.<page>Any who wish to pass must cross their weapon with my own.
SETH_GUARDIAN_TALK1: You may remain here and rest, if you choose. I am no enemy of yours. Only if you try to step beyond will I raise my weapon against you.<hpage>Then tell me, warrior, of the shrine you guard. These caves on wood's edge seem long forgotten.<page>Some things may be hidden, but never forgotten. The shrine remains to remember the wood's first seed, her that once was and always is.<page>I am the last bound to protect it. Sadly, in that service, many have fallen to my blade.

SYRINGE_LIFEBLOOD_DESC:
Spear-phial containing Plasmium.

Injecting the liquid allows one to gain health beyond their natural limits.
QUICKBIND_DESC:
Brace of surgical pins from the Whiteward. Used to forcefully insert Silk deep inside a bug's shell.

Increases the speed of binding.
EQUIP_BENCH_MSG_TRANSFORM: Transform Tools while resting at a bench.
THIEF_CLAW_DESC:
Hooked tool for the forceful retrieval of loot from bugs and husks.

Harpoon into foes to steal rosaries and shell shards, while causing additional damage.
BARBED_WIRE_DESC:
Vicious bracelet worn by those who believe they have not been duly punished.

Increases damage taken, but also increases damage dealt by the needle.
CREST_HUNTER_DESC: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes.
EQUIP_BENCH_MSG_TOOL: Equip Tools while resting at a bench.
BROLLYSPIKE_DESC:
Flexible belt of serrated metal teeth, able to affixed to the hem of a cloak.

Flaring the cloak will spin the blades, damaging surrounding enemies.
TACK_DESC:
Short pins designed to be scattered along the ground.

The sharp points will pierce any enemy who steps upon them.
DAZZLE_BIND_UPG_DESC:
Twin theatrical tools of a vainglorious bug.

When binding, emits a searing blast that damages surrounding enemies.
CREST_HUNTER_UPGRADED_DESC: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes. Build focus with successive strikes.
CONCH_DRILL_DESC:
Spiral weapon fashioned from a hardened conchspire.

Thrown at an angle, it can ricochet and catch prey off-guard.
MAGNETITE_DICE_DESC:
Playthings carved from magnetic material.

Used in simple games and believed to bring luck to the bearer.
HARPOON_DESC: Weighted pin and haft, formed to pierce tough shells.
STRAIGHT_PIN_DESC: Light throwing tool, designed for rapid attacks.
SYRINGE_LIFEBLOOD_DESC_EMPTY:
Empty spear-phial for injecting Plasmium.

Acquire more Plasmium to restore the tool.
SHELL_SATCHEL_DESC:
Quick access container formed from an old shell.

Increases the quantity of crafted tools.
UI_MSG_EXTRA_SLOT: Equip additional Tools, independent of one's Crest.
SNARE_DESC:
Trap-setting tool of the Weavers. Lays a Silk rune that ignites when foes come into contact.

Uses shell canisters and the wielder's own Silk.
MOSSCREEP_TOOL_1_DESC:
Amulet of protection formed from Mossberries.

As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
FLEA_BREW_DESC:
Invigorating beverage prepared by the Flea Caravan.

Temporarily increases the speed of movement and attacks.
STING_SHARD_DESC:
Lethal trap formed of tightly bound blades.

Once placed, the trap will pierce enemies that come into contact.
CREST_PILGRIM_DESC: Cut swiftly and nimbly with short, precise strikes.
ROSARYCANNON_DESC:
Repurposed mechanism from the base of a rosary stringing machine.

Rosaries must be inserted to reload the cannon.
SILKSHOT_DESC_ARCHITECT:
Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired and modified by Twelfth Architect.

Uses shell canisters and the wielder's own Silk to fire.
CREST_WITCH_DESC: Whip the needle in sweeping swings. Leech the life of foes through twisted roots.
SHAKRA_RING_DESC:
Hardened throwing weapon of the warrior Shakra.

Blunt force weapon that rebounds between enemies and hard surfaces.
CREST_WARRIOR_DESC: Tear foes with savage slashes. Bind to enter a wild fury and steal life from prey.
REVENGE_CRYSTAL_DESC:
Reflective stone with mnemonic properties.

When taking damage, a memory of the bearer is formed of crystal. The memory will shatter into sharp spines if an enemy comes into contact.
ROSARY_MAGNET_DESC:
Holy stone inscribed with a prayer for rosaries.

Any loose beads will be pulled toward the wearer.
MUSICIAN_CHARM_DESC:
Sophisticated Weaver device. Resonates with music played to amplify and enhance a performance.

Expands and strengthens the effects of the Needolin.
PIMPILO_DESC:
Fabric pouch filled with volatile material.

Explodes on impact with enemies or when ignited by its fuse.
RESERVE_BIND_DESC:
Ornate artefact of the Citadel, able to hold a Bind's worth of Silk. Used when healing is needed and one's natural resources run low.

The Reserve Bind will be restored when resting at a bench.
LAVA_CHARM_DESC:
Forged iron bell, crafted to ward against the intense heat of the Deep Docks.

Reduces the damage taken from flame and magma.
SCREWATTACK_DESC:
Rotary tool used for boring into bone and rock.

Drives the wielder downwards, while spinning the drill with destructive force.
ZAP_IMBUEMENT_DESC:
Charged organ from a defeated Voltvyrm.

Can be coiled around thread, imbuing Silk Skills with electric charge.
EQUIP_BENCH_MSG_CREST: Change Crests while resting at a bench.
FLINTSTONE_DESC:
Sharpening slate made from cut and polished Flintgem.

Temporarily super-heats the needle's blade, imbuing each slash with flame and increasing lethality.
SILKSHOT_DESC_FORGE:
Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired and modified by Forge Daughter.

Uses shell canisters and the wielder's own Silk to fire.
FRACTURED_MASK_DESC:
Old bug's skull carved for protection. Shields against critical damage but shatters on impact.

If shattered, the mask will be repaired while resting at a bench.
POISON_POUCH_DESC:
Pouch containing a fast-acting venom drawn from a flower's heart.

Applies venom to equipped tools.
EQUIP_BENCH_MSG_SKILL: Equip Silk Skills while resting at a bench.
COGWORK_SAW_DESC:
Expanding circular blade powered by a cogwork motor.

Propels forward, slicing through foes.
DAZZLE_BIND_DESC:
Theatrical tool of a vainglorious bug.

When binding, emits a dazzling flash that damages surrounding enemies.
WISP_LANTERN_DESC:
Broken iron lantern containing smouldering wispfire.

Wisps will spawn from the lantern and burn foes, at the cost of Silk.
THIEF_CHARM_DESC:
Symbol worn to identify oneself to fellow thieves.

Gain extra rosaries from defeated enemies, but lose some rosaries on taking damage.
USE_ITEM_MSG_MEMORY: Cannot use items while in a memory.
QUICK_SLING_DESC:
Taut-drawing mechanism built from reed and bone, intended for mounting on the limb of a bug.

Doubles the number of tools thrown.
COGWORK_FLIER_DESC: Winged cogwork companion that will seek nearby foes and attack.
MULTIBIND_DESC:
Elaborate, etched Weaver spindle, usable only by wielders of Silk.

Extends the act of binding, but increases its healing effect.
CREST_SPELL_DESC: Cast the blade forward and strengthen Silk Skills with powerful runes.
MAGGOT_CHARM_DESC:
Fragile band woven of reed and leaf, crafted to repel Muckmaggots.

If broken, the wreath will be repaired while resting at a bench.
DUSTPILO_DESC:
Fabric pouch packed with unstable powder.

Explodes on impact with enemies or when ignited by its fuse.
DEAD_MANS_PURSE_DESC:
Discarded purse of a fallen pilgrim.

Allows the bearer to retain some rosaries upon defeat.
SPRINTMASTER_DESC:
Experimental anklets of Weaver make.

Draws upon the wearer's own Silk to increase sprinting speed.
CREST_REAPER_DESC: Attack with heavy, arcing slashes and reap additional Silk from enemies.
BELL_BIND_DESC:
Holy bell inscribed with a hymn of protection.

Shields the bearer as they bind their wounds.
FLEA_BREW_DESC_EMPTY:
Empty flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.

Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
PINSTRESS_DESC:
Emblem of the Order of the Pinstress, the old blademasters of Pharloom.

Reduces charge time of Needle Strike.
CURVE_CLAWS_UPG_DESC: Radial sharpbone used by skilled hunters to take down dangerous prey.
EQUIP_BENCH_MSG:
Equip Tools in the Crest menu
while resting at a bench.
CURVE_CLAWS_DESC: Arched sharpbone used by hunters to take down flying prey.
EQUIP_BENCH_MSG_RELOAD: Reload Tools while resting at a bench.
COMPASS_DESC:
Intricate tracking device, carved from shell.

When equipped, the bearer's location will be marked on their map.
UI_MSG_EQUIP_CREST: To change Crest, open the Crest screen of the Menu while resting at a bench.
SCUTTLEBRACE_DESC:
Artificial spine that clasps tight around the shell.

Enhances the wearer's innate flexibility, allowing rapid retreat.
LIGHTNING_ROD_DESC:
Convertible orbs containing electricity.

The vessels can be thrown as a bola for an explosive discharge or staked as a spear to release a column of energy.
SPOOL_EXTENDER_DESC:
Silk-storing tool of the Citadel, fashioned after an artefact of the Weavers.

Allows the storing of additional Silk beyond one's natural abilities.
BONE_NECKLACE_DESC:
Crude trinket worn by collectors and crafters.

Allows one to collect more shell shards from defeated creatures.
WALLCLING_DESC: Gilded piton that allows one to hold in place while on a wall.
EXTRACTOR_DESC:
Tool designed to extract and store fluids.

To pierce its target, the Needle Phial must first be charged to full tension.
FLEA_CHARM_DESC:
Icon of the mythical mother flea, passed down from caravans of old. A symbol of protection and kinship.

Decreases the cost of Silk Skills while health is full.
WHITE_RING_DESC:
Gleaming apparatus of Weaver make. Its core emits a faint glow.

Increases the speed of Silk regeneration.
MOSSCREEP_TOOL_2_DESC:
Powerful amulet of protection formed from many Mossberries.

As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
TUT_MSG_DESC: Equip tools for aid in combat or exploration.
WEIGHTED_ANKLET_DESC:
Heavy band favoured by those with an unsteady step.

The wearer will recoil less when striking foes and will not be flung as far when taking damage.
LONGNEEDLE_DESC:
Talisman fashioned from the talon of a large predator.

Increases the range of needle attacks.
FLEA_BREW_DESC_EMPTY_BROKEN:
Shattered flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.

Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
SILKSHOT_DESC_WEAVER:
Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired to its original form.

Uses shell canisters and the wielder's own Silk to fire.
CREST_TOOLMASTER_DESC: Spin the needle as a screw, shredding foes. Spend Silk to rapidly craft new tools.
TRI_PIN_DESC: Flat, layered weapon, crafted to be thrown in a set.
INV_DESC_MOSSBERRY: Sweet fruit that grows in moist environments. Its seeds are toxic to most creatures.
RELIC_SEAL_CHIT_MEMORIUM_DESC:
Report of the Memorium and its maintenance.

“Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.
Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.
Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.
Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.”
INV_DESC_CRAWBELL:
Nest fashioned from an old bell. Once set up, young Craws will occasionally roost within, filling the bell with shell shards and rosaries.

The Crawbell can be installed on the exterior of a home.
INV_DESC_ROCK_ROLLER_ITEM: Gem-like organ taken from a Flintbeetle. Produces incendiary sparks when abraded, and may explode if cracked or dropped.
INV_DESC_CREST_SOCKET:
Keepsake containing a precious memory. Can be used to expand a Crest.

Expand Crests in the Crest pane of the Menu.
GET_JOURNAL_1: Defeat foes to add their records to the Journal.
GET_JOURNAL_2: Review defeated foes in the Journal pane of the Menu.
INV_DESC_TOOLPOUCH: Basic pouch designed for holding tools, traps and crafting materials.
INV_DESC_SPRINT_MEMENTO: Gilded trophy awarded by Sprintmaster Swift to the fastest bug in Pharloom.
INV_DESC_COG_HEART: Reassembled cogwork heart, containing a fine array of wheels and regulators.
INV_DESC_HEART_HUNTER: Enlivened heart of Skarrsinger Karmelita. Its beat is steady and strong.
RELIC_BONE_RECORD_UNDERMAP_DESC:
Filthy rag, marked with the scrawl of an Underworker.

“So much suffering. Are we truly chosen, or have we sinned unknowing, and now are punished for it?”
INV_DESC_SKILL_SILKBOMB: Forgotten Weaver technique. Sew rending runes upon one's enemies.
INV_DESC_HEART_PIECE_FULL: An ancient mask carved from cold, pale ore. The mask protects the wearer, guarding their shell against damage.
RELIC_PSALM_CYLINDER_LIBRARY_DESC: Voices of the Choir, raised in sacred song.
INV_DESC_BELLCLAPPER_ITEM: Finely forged bell made from a gleaming metal.
INV_DESC_SONGPILGRIM_CLOAK_ITEM: Garment gifted to pilgrims on admittance to the Citadel. Its thick weave offers additional protection against wind and cold.
INV_DESC_GOURMAND_VINTAGE_NECTAR: High quality nectar of a long-lived aphid, kept in storage over many lifetimes to allow a complex maturation.
INV_DESC_SILK_GRUB: Grub that lives within and feeds upon Pharloom's lingering Silk, born with the ability to sense Silk over great distances.
INV_DESC_CORAL_CHUNK: Chunk of dense coral-shell. Not fit for crafting tools, but claimed to have various medicinal properties if correctly prepared.
INV_DESC_SLAB_KEYRING: Keys to the cells and passages of the Slab.
INV_DESC_COIN_MID: Beads carved from polished shell. The finer material reflects their increased value.
INV_DESC_DOCK_KEY: Small worker's key. Unlocks the door to the diving bell in Deep Docks.
INV_DESC_MORSEL_SHREDDED: Meat harvested from a defeated creature. It has been diced into fine chunks.
INV_DESC_ROACH_CORPSE_ITEM: Fresh innards of a Muckroach, tough and slimy with a rank odour. Unpalatable to most.
RELIC_BONE_RECORD_WISP_DESC:
Crumpled parchment containing the prayer of a Burning Bug.

“Hail to your heat! O glorious flame. You who builds and breaks us. Sear our shells. Char them black. That we may rise to join you, wreathed in bright and blazing joy.”
INV_DESC_BLUE_GOOP_FULL: Liquid lifeseed extracted from a ripe bud. Possesses regenerative qualities.
RELIC_WEAVER_RECORD_WEAVE08_DESC:
Words of a Weaver from the nest beneath Bone Bottom.

“Hide her deep, the despised child, our shame shown in shell of iron. She is a wish cast vain, divinity mimicked in form too frail.”
INV_DESC_SETH_MEMENTO: Aged medallion of the wanderer Seth. A gift given in respect of great skill.
INV_DESC_COIN_SET_M2: String threaded with a mix of common and fine rosaries. Can be broken and the rosaries used to trade.
INV_DESC_NAIL2: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The blade is honed to a fine edge.
RELIC_SEAL_CHIT_CITY_MERCHANT_DESC:
Last edict of the Conductors.

“And lo, is eternity sustained. By Architect's claw, we welcome that final form, of dial and rotor, and soul gladly given.

The perfect, unfaltering voice.”
INV_DESC_SHELL_FLOWER: Core of a flower formed around the body of a consumed Wood Wasp. Secretes a sticky sap that the wasps subsist on.
INV_DESC_PLINNEY_TOOLS: Bile gland of a rare sylphean slug. Talented pinmasters can use the glistening liquid within to improve a blade's sharpness.
INV_DESC_R_BONE_RECORD: Crude journal made of coarse fabric and bone, left by a fallen pilgrim.
RELIC_SEAL_CHIT_WARDCORPSE_DESC:
Surgeon's orders.

“Devout has succumbed during Silk suture. Refuses to revive. Sin committed. Permit no rites.

Husk marked for cremation. Retrieve dregs.”
INV_DESC_BROODMOTHER_REMAINS: Gelatinous organ collected from the defeated Broodmother.
INV_DESC_PLASMIUM_GLAND:
Pulsating organ grown within the shell of Alchemist Zylotol. The gland replenishes over time, providing a near limitless source of Plasmium.

Crafting new Plasmium Phials no longer requires a reserve.
RELIC_ANCIENT_EGG_DESC:
An artefact almost impossibly old, marked inside with many fine etchings. Most are indecipherable.

“...No will... No self... Shade...”
INV_DESC_MEMENTO_SURFACE: Worn ornament of the Nameless Town high above Pharloom.
INV_DESC_THREAD:
Versatile thread naturally produced within the shell. When enough Silk is stored, wounds can be healed and skills executed.

Attack enemies to replenish Silk.
INV_DESC_SPOOL_PIECE_FULL: Artefact left behind by the Weavers, designed to collect and hold additional Silk.
INV_DESC_SHARD: Hardened fragments of shell and bone, used in the crafting of tools and traps.
INV_DESC_THREAD_HEART:
Silk thread naturally produced within the shell. When enough Silk is stored, wounds can be healed and skills executed.

Silk Hearts will automatically regenerate some Silk.

Attack enemies to replenish Silk.
INV_DESC_SHININGCOG: Pristine cog from within the shell of an automaton. Despite long use, its metal has not dulled.
INV_DESC_PRISTINE_CORE: Intricate internal mechanism of a cogwork bug. Can be broken into individual shell shards for use in crafting.
INV_DESC_SKILL_MEMORY_MELODY: Attune to the old memories of Pharloom.
INV_DESC_HEART_CORAL: Enlivened heart of Crust King Khann. It beats deep and slow.
INV_DESC_PICKLEDEGG: Pungent delicacy preserved in roach brine. The most famous creation of the disgraced chef Lugoli.
INV_DESC_BROKEN_SILKSHOT:
Remains of an ancient Weaver implement, broken and inoperable.

A craftsbug of high skill may be able to repair it.
RELIC_SEAL_CHIT_ASPID_DESC:
Decree of the Citadel, dirty and worn.

“Full Chamber to the kingdom of the White Wyrm. Claim the Weaver, in half part. Last of their line. Sensed strong with Silk.

Resistance anticipated. Quell with rune cage.”
INV_DESC_VOID: Writhing substance from the dark sea at the world's base.
INV_DESC_SK_FRAGMENT: Large spike of bone collected from a defeated Skull Tyrant.
RELIC_PSALM_CYLINDER_GRINDLE_DESC: Guide track for the Choir, with a theme of salvation.
INV_DESC_SLAB_KEYRING_SINGLE_SWAMP: Key with the mark of ‘Apostate'. Opens the way to certain cells and passages of the Slab.
INV_DESC_MATERIUM:
Tubes and receptacles built for the storing, recording and research of various materials.

The Materium can be assembled in a home.
INV_DESC_WHITE_FLOWER: Ethereal flower plucked from a deep and distant memory. Glows with soft, pale light that wards against the void.
INV_DESC_NAIL3: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The blade gleams sharper than ever before.
INV_DESC_NAIL4: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The highly refined blade reveals its hivesteel banding.
INV_DESC_QUILL: Writing implement for recording one's travels. Can be used to update any acquired maps.
INV_DESC_SILKBOSS_NEEDLE: Technique taken from the primal source of Silk. Spin talons from thread that seek out enemies.
RELIC_WEAVER_TOTEM_BONETOWN_DESC:
Carving of Camora, Weaver of healing. A prayer is etched upon it.

“Weaver, heal my sons, their fearful hearts, their limbs that shake at the climb to come. We pray, gift but a glimmer of your strength, that when we stand before your divinity, you see bugs shed free of fear.”
INV_DESC_WALLJUMP: Ancient Weaver technique. Cling to sheer surfaces and leap off to rapidly scale heights.
INV_DESC_GROWSTONE:
Cold, steely stone with remarkable regrowth capacity.

If shattered into shell shards, it will reform over time.
INV_DESC_TOKEN_FAITH:
Rusted key of common design. Can be used to open a range of simple locks.

Degraded by time, it will break after a single use.
INV_DESC_TOOL_METAL:
Rare element found naturally within the rock and bone of Pharloom.

Used by skilled craftsbugs in the construction of tools and trinkets.
INV_DESC_COG_HEART_PIECES: Two parts of a cogwork heart, containing an intricate array of wheels and regulators.
INV_DESC_MOMENTO_HEART_EXTRA: The heart can be displayed in a home.
INV_DESC_MEMENTO_FLEA: Rare symbolic medallion, given only to a true friend of fleas.
INV_DESC_SKILL_BELLBEAST_MELODY: Summon the Beastlings and return together to their mother.
INV_DESC_POUCHANDTOOLKIT: A pouch for holding traps and tools, and fine crafting implements to increase their lethality.
MAT_DESC_VOLTSTONE: Hard, charged stone that can catch, store and discharge electricity.
INV_DESC_R_WEAVER_TOTEM: Carved bone idol of an ancient Weaver. A prayer is etched upon its body.
INV_DESC_SNARE_SOUL_SWAMP: Cracked shell containing soul drawn from a long deceased bug.
INV_DESC_GOURMAND_MOSSBERRY_STEW: Thick, syrupy soup of Mossberries and druidic herbs. Sweet and aromatic, but poisonous to most creatures.
INV_DESC_SKILL_PARRY: Deflective technique of a creature spun from thread. Bind Silk around the needle to deflect enemy attacks and instantly strike back.
INV_DESC_COIN_BIG: Gleaming pearl carved over with intricate markings. The rarest and most highly valued rosaries in all of Pharloom.
INV_DESC_SPOOL_PIECE_HALF:
One half of an artefact left behind by the Weavers, designed to collect and hold Silk.

A completed spool will allow one to hold more Silk within their shell.
INV_DESC_SKILL_THROW: Deadly Weaver technique. Throw the needle forward with force amplified by coiled Silk.
RELIC_SEAL_CHIT_SILK_SIPHON:
Tattered decree of the Citadel.

“Bug of voice grown hoarse or shell fallen frail, you have been selected for duty most sacred.

Become our light, our guide in darkness, that others worthy may climb to join the holy song.”
INV_DESC_MORSEL_SPEARED: Meat harvested from a defeated creature. It has been cleanly speared through, but is otherwise intact.
INV_DESC_MEMENTO_GARMOND: Heirloom of a village lost to Pharloom's Haunting.
INV_DESC_HEART_PIECE_1:
Shard of an ancient mask worn to protect oneself from harm.

Complete a mask to strengthen the shell and protect against damage.
INV_DESC_R_PSALM_CYL:
Metallic cylinder of Citadel make, etched with a recording of sound.

The cylinder can be played in a gramophone.
RELIC_BONE_RECORD_GREYCOR_DESC:
Faded parchment containing the last words of a lost pilgrim.

“-ter I die here in the damp dark than join those poor sods, trapped to stumble, aimless and empty, until their limbs fall to dust.”
INV_DESC_MAPANDQUILL: Map of Pharloom and a quill for recording one's travels. When resting at a bench or elsewhere, the map will be updated with newly discovered areas.
INV_DESC_SKILL_SPHERE: Deadly Weaver technique. Cast the needle in a whirl of Silk around oneself, lashing foes.
INV_DESC_SKILL_NEEDOLIN: Holy Weaver talent. Play ancient melodies by stringing Silk along the needle.
INV_DESC_SKILL_EVAHEAL: Essence of a being merged within. Silk will be restored when resting at a bench.
INV_DESC_R_PSALM_CYL_MELODY:
Metallic cylinder of Citadel make, etched with the melody of the Vaultkeepers.

The cylinder can be played in a gramophone.
MAT_DESC_SMELTSTONE: Long burning rock from the base of Pharloom. Mined and used by the Citadel in its forgings.
INV_DESC_COG_HEART_PIECE: One part of a cogwork heart, containing an intricate mechanism of wheels and regulators.
INV_DESC_DRESS_BROLLY: Simple protective garb, sewn through with flexible spines.
INV_DESC_HUNTER_MEMENTO: Seal symbol given in recognition of a true Hunter, stamped in sticky goo.
INV_DESC_GOURMAND_CORAL_INGREDIENT: Tough, furred seed from the centre of a corpora cluster. Stale to taste, but strong once ground as seasoning.
RELIC_PSALM_CYLINDER_HANG_DESC: Guide track for the Choir, with a theme of ascendence.
INV_DESC_R_WEAVER_RECORD: Old Weaver recording instrument, strung with Silk runes. The faded runes hold a Weaver's words from ages gone.
INV_DESC_SLAB_KEYRING_SINGLE: Key with the mark of ‘Indolent'. Opens the way to certain cells and passages of the Slab.
INV_DESC_CROW_FEATHER: Tattered pelt taken from the body of a Crawbug. Fragile and drab, it is considered to have few practical uses.
INV_DESC_SKILL_SILKDASH: Deadly Weaver technique. Pierce through enemies in a blur of blade and Silk.
INV_DESC_CONCHFLY_REMAINS: Hard horn piece, broken from the tip of a Conchfly's shell.
INV_DESC_SHARD_POUCH: Small bundle of shell shards tied together with string. Can be broken to use the shards for crafting.
INV_DESC_SNARE_SOUL_BELLHERMIT: Heavy bell filled with the shimmering soul of the Bell Hermit.
RELIC_BONE_RECORD_BONEEAST_DESC:
Singed parchment containing a pilgrim's scrawl.

“My dear companions, all are gone now, devoured, scorched, fallen to exhaustion, or worse, seduced by the Haunting.”
INV_DESC_MORSEL_SEARED: Meat harvested from a defeated creature. It has been seared in a way that noticeably affects the flavour.
MAT_DESC_LIFEBLOOD: Liquid lifeseed, possessed of remarkable regenerative qualities. A substance foreign to Pharloom, introduced by the Alchemist Zylotol.
INV_DESC_DRESS_DJ: Protective garb lined with the soft down of a Fayforn and sewn through with flexible spines.
INV_DESC_BEASTFLY_REMAINS: Hardened chunk of horned shell collected from a defeated Savage Beastfly.
INV_DESC_SKILL_ASCENT: Ancient Weaver talent. Throw the needle upward and launch to tremendous heights.
INV_DESC_SKILL_HARPOON: Advanced Weaver talent. Throw the Silk-strung needle like a harpoon and charge towards it.
RELIC_SEAL_CHIT_SLABCORPSE_DESC:
Sentence issued by the Citadel Ministers.

“Chosen of the Choir, by grace of our magnanimous Conductors you are granted mercy. When you exit that cage, an elder bug of sins absolved, you may rejoin our flock and feel our light, and never again shall your voice fall silent.”
INV_DESC_COIN_SET_L: Heavy necklace laden with pearl rosaries. Can be broken and the rosaries used to trade.
RELIC_WEAVER_TOTEM_WITCH_DESC:
Carving of Keelal, Weaver of the path. A prayer is etched upon it.

“Blessed Weaver, lady of grace, you who see our sin, our frail shells, our voices weak, and still offer your protection. How great your mind to care so much for ones so lowly.”
INV_DESC_SILK_GRUB_FUNCTION: Consume the Silkeater to retrieve a cocoon after falling in battle.
INV_DESC_RELIC: A relic of Pharloom's past, interesting to collectors of historical items.
INV_DESC_COIN_SET_F: Worn string holding a meagre amount of rosaries. Can be broken and the loose rosaries used to trade.
INV_DESC_COIN_SET_S: Short string of rosaries. Can be broken and the rosaries used to trade.
INV_DESC_R_SEAL_CHIT: Order issued by the Citadel. The once gleaming seal has worn with time.
INV_DESC_MEMENTO_CROWMAN: Iron emblem of the Court of Craws, absolving the bearer of all crimes past and future.
INV_DESC_MEMENTO_GREY:
Engraved cruststone, worn by sand and blanched by time.

...Watch...Remember...Till time... Life anew...
INV_DESC_DOCK_DEMO_KEY: Small worker's key. Unlocks the gate in the middle of Deep Docks.
INV_DESC_SKILL_SPRINT: Fabled Weaver talent. Dash forward and sprint with unnatural speed, as though gliding upon Silk.
INV_DESC_MOMENTO_EXTRA: The memento can be displayed in a home.
RELIC_WEAVER_RECORD_SPRINT_DESC:
Plea of a Weaver from the furthest edge of Pharloom.

“Flee, sisters. Flee until your strength exhausts, so far you may escape at last her silken sight.

To start anew, to sustain, free of web and service eternal.”
INV_DESC_PILGRIM_RAGS_ITEM: Simple garment worn by several pilgrims over the ages. Torn, tattered and repaired many times over.
INV_DESC_FIXER_IDOL: Small sculpture, inexpertly but painstakingly crafted as a symbol of enduring friendship.
INV_DESC_NAIL5: Long sewing tool, uniquely balanced for combat. The Hivesteel blade has been sharpened to its ultimate form.
